definition: to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Although he made full prostrations for eighteen years, he never saw this Sutra.
sentences.chinese: 叩头礼拜十八年，结果也没有见着这一部经。

definition: to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom)/fig. to pound the ground with one's head
to kneel down/to sink to one's knees/to grovel
to thank sb for favor (esp. emperor or superior official)
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to bow with hands held in front
to kneel as in prayer (without sitting back on the heels)
